name: Protecting & Repairing Shea Butter Intensive Hand Balm
categories: Bath & Body, Body Moisturizers, Hand Cream & Foot Cream
about: What it is:An intensely nourishing hand balm crafted with 25 percent shea butter to comfort, moisturize, and care for dry hands..Skin Type:Dry.Skincare Concerns:Dryness.Formulation:Balm.Highlighted Ingredients:- Shea Butter: Supplies a high concentration of omega-6 fatty acids and nourishes and softens skin..Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens and phthalates. It is also vegan..What Else You Need to Know:Now formulated for the whole family (ages three and up), this rich balm nourishes and protects skin from environmental aggressors that lead to dryness, such as cold weather and water. Its high concentration of shea butter (25 percent) leaves hands soothed and softened..Clinical Results:In a consumer test on 33 volunteers:
ingredients: -Shea Butter: Supplies a high concentration of omega-6 fatty acids and nourishes and softens skin...Aqua/Water, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Tapioca Starch, Coco-Caprylate/Caprate, Cetearyl Alcohol, Glyceryl Stearate SE, Brassica Campestris (Rapeseed) Sterols, Sodium PCA, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Hydrogenated Rapeseed Oil, Cetearyl Glucoside, Sodium Stearoyl Glutamate, Xanthan Gum, Sodium Gluconate, Glyceryl Caprylate, Tocopherol, Citric Acid, Beta-Glucan, Caprylyl Glycol, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Parfum/Fragrance.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Gently massage onto nails, cuticles, back of hands, and palms..-Apply a thick layer to hands, leave on for 10 minutes, then massage any excess into skin twice a week for an intensely moisturizing effect.

reviews.review_text: Midwest Winters are THE WORST for skin. Dry. Dry. Dry. Or This L’Occitane  is a fast absorbing, shea butter laden hand cream that you can use your hands to apply anywhere. Listen: wanna save $$$ on tell tale signs of aging? Botox is NOT where to start. Obviously it’s with sunscreen immediately out of the womb and then every day after, but a second close is caring for your hands. NOTHING shows your age more, and no one clocks your age faster, than by the skin on the back of your hands. No joke. This hand cream is heavy duty enough, but not heavy or too greasy, that it can’t absorb quickly enough for you to continue practicing throwing hatchets or whatever it is you do that requires hands that are not slippery. I use this with the L’Occitane heavy cream, as it makes for an ideal ol' lotion foot in ugly socks” overnight treatment. The shea scent is a bit perfume-y  and not like the sweet, yet earthy scent I’m used to when it comes to shea. This brand’s ALMOND scented line is PHENOMENAL, btw.  Anyway, invest in your hands, in your future. You can’t avoid the change, but you can slow and soften it easily and inexpensively, comparatively speaking. Treat yo self!!
